segment.source: MED-V 1.0 SP1 and SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: MED-V 1.0 SP1 and SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: MED-V 1.0 SP1 and SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: MED-V 1.0 SP1 and SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: MED-V 1.0 SP1 and SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: MED-V 1.0 SP1 and SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) platform.
segment.target: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) platform.

segment.source: These Release Notes contain information that you must have to successfully install the MED-V platform.
segment.target: These Release Notes contain information that you must have to successfully install the MED-V platform.

segment.source: This document contains information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: This document contains information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a discrepancy between these Release Notes and other MED-V platform documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a discrepancy between these Release Notes and other MED-V platform documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These Release Notes supersede the content included with this product.
segment.target: These Release Notes supersede the content included with this product.

segment.source: About the Product Documentation
segment.target: About the Product Documentation

segment.source: Comprehensive documentation for Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) platform is available.
segment.target: Comprehensive documentation for Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) platform is available.

segment.source: Refer to the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization Planning, Deployment, and Operations Guide.
segment.target: Refer to the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization Planning, Deployment, and Operations Guide.

segment.source: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses
segment.target: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses

segment.source: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, you should install the latest available security updates for any new software that you are installing.
segment.target: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, you should install the latest available security updates for any new software that you are installing.

segment.source: For more information, see the Microsoft Security website at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482.
segment.target: For more information, see the Microsoft Security website at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482.

segment.source: What’s New in MED-V 1.0 SP2
segment.target: What’s New in MED-V 1.0 SP2

segment.source: MED-V 1.0 SP2 includes the following updates to the MED-V 1.0 SP1 features and functionality:
segment.target: MED-V 1.0 SP2 includes the following updates to the MED-V 1.0 SP1 features and functionality:

segment.source: Support for running MED-V on a Chinese traditional or Chinese simplified workstation.
segment.target: Support for running MED-V on a Chinese traditional or Chinese simplified workstation.

segment.source: Support for the MED-V 1.0 SP2 client to run on Windows 7 SP1.
segment.target: Support for the MED-V 1.0 SP2 client to run on Windows 7 SP1.

segment.source: Improved performance for the applications that are running in the MED-V workspace when MED-V frames around the published applications are turned-on.
segment.target: Improved performance for the applications that are running in the MED-V workspace when MED-V frames around the published applications are turned-on.

segment.source: Previously, under some instances the MED-V frames had to be turned-off for the applications to run correctly.
segment.target: Previously, under some instances the MED-V frames had to be turned-off for the applications to run correctly.

segment.source: Known Issues with MED-V 1.0 SP1 and MED-V 1.0 SP2
segment.target: Known Issues with MED-V 1.0 SP1 and MED-V 1.0 SP2

segment.source: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 1.0 SP1 platform.
segment.target: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 1.0 SP1 platform.

segment.source: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases may contradict existing product documentation.
segment.target: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases may contradict existing product documentation.

segment.source: Whenever possible, these issues are addressed in later releases.
segment.target: Whenever possible, these issues are addressed in later releases.

segment.source: MED-V does not provide Windows 7 advanced user experience support
segment.target: MED-V does not provide Windows 7 advanced user experience support

segment.source: MED-V 1.0 SP1 does not provide Windows 7 advanced user experience support, such as the following:
segment.target: MED-V 1.0 SP1 does not provide Windows 7 advanced user experience support, such as the following:

segment.source: Docking windows to the top, left, or right is not applied to published application windows.
segment.target: Docking windows to the top, left, or right is not applied to published application windows.

segment.source: The Windows 7 taskbar preview does not display the published application content.
segment.target: The Windows 7 taskbar preview does not display the published application content.
